item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Isak Dineson
item.description: "I write a little every day, without hope and without despair." -- Isak Dineson

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Martin Espada
item.description: "Even the most political poem is an act of faith." -- Martin Espada

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Naomi Shihab Nye
item.description: "Being good felt like a heavy coat, so I took it off." -- Naomi Shihab Nye

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Dan Savage
item.description: "every relationship you are in will fail, until one doesn't " -- Dan Savage

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Dan Savage
item.description: "Kids are like heroin, a little heroin addiction. When it’s bad, you’ve never been so miserable, but when it’s good you’ve never been so high." -- Dan Savage

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "If you let people into your life a little bit, they can be pretty damn amazing." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "The world, even the smallest parts of it, is filled with things you don't know." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "If you care about something enough, it’s going to make you cry. But you have to use it. Use your tears. Use your pain. Use your fear. Get mad. Arnold, get mad." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "Life is a constant struggle between being an individual and being a member of the community." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Since that time, war had literally been continuous, though strictly speaking it had not always been the same war." -- George Orwell

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "Nothing exists except an endless present in which the Party is always right." -- George Orwell

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Michael Lesy
item.description: "The choice, though, is not between scrupulous obedience and ecstatic abandon. The choice runs right down the middle. If you really want to know how to fly, you need to know how to walk." -- Michael Lesy

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Jennifer Baumgardner
item.description: "What I'm asserting is that we are looking at bisexuality the wrong way, making the identity entirely dependent on someone other that the bisexual person him- or herself. If I'm dating a man, I'm straight. If I'm dating a woman, I'm a lesbian. But sexuality is not who you sleep with, it's who you are. It doesn't change according to who is standing next to you." -- Jennifer Baumgardner

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Fundamental accuracy of statement is the ONE sole morality of writing." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Nikki Giovanni
item.description: "There is always something to do. There are hungry people to feed, naked people to clothe, sick people to comfort and make well. And while I don't expect you to save the world I do think it's not asking too much for you to love those with whom you sleep, share the happiness of those whom you call friend, engage those among you who are visionary and remove from your life those who offer you depression, despair and disrespect." -- Nikki Giovanni

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "You’ll get over it…” It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it” is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?" -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "The Buddhists say there are 149 ways to God. I'm not looking for God, only for myself, and that is far more complicated. God has had a great deal written about Him; nothing has been written about me. God is bigger, like my mother, easier to find, even in the dark. I could be anywhere, and since I can't describe myself I can't ask for help." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "I distrust those people who know so well what God wants them to do because I notice it always coincides with their own desires." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Power without love is reckless and abusive, and love without power is sentimental and anemic. Power at its best is love implementing the demands of justice, and justice at its best is power correcting everything that stands against love." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Abraham Joshua Heschel
item.description: "Our goal should be to live life in radical amazement. ....get up in the morning and look at the world in a way that takes nothing for granted. Everything is phenomenal; everything is incredible; never treat life casually. To be spiritual is to be amazed." -- Abraham Joshua Heschel

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Abraham Joshua Heschel
item.description: "It is customary to blame secular science and anti-religious philosophy for the eclipse of religion in modern society. It would be more honest to blame religion for its own defeats. Religion declined not because it was refuted, but because it became irrelevant, dull, oppressive, insipid. When faith is completely replaced by creed, worship by discipline, love by habit; when the crisis of today is ignored because of the splendor of the past; when faith becomes an heirloom rather than a living fountain; when religion speaks only in the name of authority rather than with the voice of compassion--its message becomes meaningless." -- Abraham Joshua Heschel

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "My silences had not protected me. Your silence will not protect you. But for every real word spoken, for every attempt I had ever made to speak those truths for which I am still seeking, I had made contact with other women while we examined the words to fit a world in which we all believed, bridging our differences." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Real Supergirl add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "We must take sides. Neutrality helps the oppressor, never the victim. Silence encourages the tormentor, never the tormented. Sometimes we must interfere. When human lives are endangered, when human dignity is in jeopardy, national borders and sensitivities become irrelevant. Wherever men and women are persecuted because of their race, religion, or political views, that place must - at that moment - become the center of the universe." -- Elie Wiesel
